title: Typeface for "Stranger than Fiction" GUI?
content:
Sorry if this is an obvious question, but I can’t seem to track down the typeface for the white text used throughout the movie representing Harold Crick’s thoughts in Stranger Than Fiction. I was hoping that someone here could guide to the proper face...

Here are a few links to videos and screen grabs:

[http://bclgrh.blogspot.com/2007/06/mk12-stranger-than-fiction-gui.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907055408/http:/bclgrh.blogspot.com/2007/06/mk12-stranger-than-fiction-gui.html "http://bclgrh.blogspot.com/2007/06/mk12-stranger-than-fiction-gui.html")

[http://jenniferthai.wordpress.com/2008/01/09/mk12/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907055408/http:/jenniferthai.wordpress.com/2008/01/09/mk12/ "http://jenniferthai.wordpress.com/2008/01/09/mk12/")

Thanks for your help!

comments.content: FYI, if you have the DVD, there’s a bonus featurette on the GUI design. I don’t recall if they specifically talked about typefaces, though.

Apropos of STF - Did anybody else find Emma Thompson’s habit of spitting in a tissue to put her \*\*\*\* out as utterly revolting as I did?

Hmm.. that’s strange - I entered the English colloquial for cigarette; Eff Ay Gee, and it was censored! Ha ha ha - so prudish you Americans!

Nick Cooke
It was a great movie overall. Any designer will enjoy the GUI graphics of the watch. And hey, Wreckless Eric was in the soundtrack!
